conclusion: Determine the maximum value of force F for blocks A and B to remain stationary relative to each other.
Acceleration of both blocks must be the same for them to remain stationary relative to each other.
Block A is on top of block B, and a horizontal force F is applied to block B.
Weight of block A is 10 N.
Normal force from block B on A is 10 N.
Maximum static friction force between A and B is 1 N.
Net force on block A in the horizontal direction is f_s = m_A a.
Acceleration a of block A must be less than or equal to 1 m/s².
Weight of block B is 20 N.
Total weight of A and B is 30 N.
Normal force from the ground on B is 30 N.
Kinetic friction force between B and the ground is 3 N.
Net force on block B in the horizontal direction is F - 3 N = m_B a.
Substitute a = 1 m/s² into the equation for block B to find F.
The condition for keeping A and B relatively stationary is that F does not exceed 5 N.
